text: can install development version destep like :

title: A toolkit to convert DeST models to EnergyPlus models
text: package still heavy development ready use. Currently, following components supported: Geometry Material Construction Internal gains [WIP] Shading HVAC

title: A toolkit to convert DeST models to EnergyPlus models
code: library(destep)  # use a DeST typical building model as an example path <- download_dest_model("Commercial office A", "Chongqin", 2015, tempdir())  # make sure EnergyPlus IDD file can be found even if EnergyPlus itself was not # installed eplusr::use_idd(23.1, download = "auto") #> IDD v23.1.0 has not been parsed before. #> Try to locate 'Energy+.idd' in EnergyPlus v23.1.0 installation folder '/Applications/EnergyPlus-23-1-0'. #> IDD file found: '/Users/hongyuanjia/Applications/EnergyPlus-23-1-0/Energy+.idd'. #> Start parsing... #> Parsing completed. #> ── EnergyPlus Input Data Dictionary ──────────────────────────────────────────── #> * Version: 23.1.0 #> * Build: 87ed9199d4 #> * Total Class: 840  # read the DeST model and convert it to an EnergyPlus model read_dest(path) |> to_eplus(23.1) #> There are windows in the input DeST model. However, the optical properties of the glazing in DeST are not one-to-one match with the glazing in EnergyPlus. Here the optical properties of a 3mm clear glazing in EnergyPlus dataset 'WindowGlassMaterials.idf' will be used for all glazing in DeST. Please check the results in the converted IDF file. #> ── EnergPlus Input Data File ─────────────────────────────────────────────────── #>  • Path: NOT LOCAL #>  • Version: '23.1.0' #>  #> Group: <Simulation Parameters> #> ├─ [001<O>] Class: <Version> #> └─ [001<O>] Class: <Building> #>  #> Group: <Location and Climate> #> └─ [001<O>] Class: <Site:Location> #>  #> Group: <Surface Construction Elements> #> ├─ [014<O>] Class: <Material> #> │─ [001<O>] Class: <WindowMaterial:Glazing> #> │─ [001<O>] Class: <WindowMaterial:Gas> #> └─ [007<O>] Class: <Construction> #>  #> Group: <Thermal Zones and Surfaces> #> ├─ [036<O>] Class: <Zone> #> │─ [003<O>] Class: <ZoneList> #> │─ [003<O>] Class: <ZoneGroup> #> └─ [470<O>] Class: <BuildingSurface:Detailed>

what: Convert Microsoft Access database to SQLite using DBI — access_to_sqlite_dbi
title: Convert Microsoft Access database to SQLite using DBI — access_to_sqlite_dbi
text: Convert Microsoft Access database SQLite using DBI

title: Convert Microsoft Access database to SQLite using DBI — access_to_sqlite_dbi
code: access_to_sqlite_dbi(   accdb,   sqlite = ":memory:",   tables = NULL,   drop = TRUE,   verbose = FALSE )

title: Convert Microsoft Access database to SQLite using DBI — access_to_sqlite_dbi
text: accdb [string] Path DeST model file. Usually Microsoft Access database file .accdb extension. sqlite [string] Path SQLite database file. :memory:, default, temporary -memory database created. tables [character] Vector table names read DeST model. NULL, default, tables read. drop [logical] Whether drop tables SQLite database already exist. Default TRUE. verbose [logical] Whether print information conversion process. Default FALSE.

title: Convert Microsoft Access database to SQLite using DBI — access_to_sqlite_dbi
text: works Windows. macOS Linux, use access_to_sqlite_mdbtools() instead.

what: Convert Microsoft Access database to SQLite using mdbtools — access_to_sqlite_mdbtools

title: Convert Microsoft Access database to SQLite using mdbtools — access_to_sqlite_mdbtools
code: access_to_sqlite_mdbtools(   accdb,   sqlite = ":memory:",   tables = NULL,   drop = TRUE,   verbose = FALSE )

title: Convert Microsoft Access database to SQLite using mdbtools — access_to_sqlite_mdbtools
text: accdb [string] Path DeST model file. Usually Microsoft Access database file .accdb extension. sqlite [string] Path SQLite database file. :memory:, default, temporary -memory database created. tables [character] Vector table names read DeST model. NULL, default, tables read. drop [logical] Whether drop tables SQLite database already exist. Default TRUE. verbose [logical] Whether print information conversion process. Default FALSE.

title: Convert Microsoft Access database to SQLite using mdbtools — access_to_sqlite_mdbtools
text: function requires 'mdbtools' installed can found PATH, means works macOS Linux. Windows, use access_to_sqlite_dbi() instead.

text: dest [DBIConnection] SQLite database connection DeST model. tables [character] Vector table names update. NULL, default, tables updated.

title: Update NAME column in DeST tables — destep_update_name
text: [DBIConnection] database connection object.

title: Update NAME column in DeST tables — destep_update_name
text: EnergyPlus, object names unique scope belonging class. However, DeST, 'NAME' column likely empty '.' table. function can called actual conversion starts update values 'NAME' column make sure follow EnergyPlus requirements. updating process consists two steps: Fill empty name column prefix name empty '.'. prefix based table name. Add suffix names duplicated names.

title: Convert a DeST model to EnergyPlus model — to_eplus
Convert a DeST model to EnergyPlus model — to_eplus
text: dest [string DBIConnection] path DeST model file DBIConnection object. ver [string] character string specifying EnergyPlus version. can "latest", default, indicate using latest EnergyPlus version supported {eplusr} package. copy [logical] Whether copy input DeST database temporary SQLite database. Note FALSE, input database modified conversion. Default TRUE.

title: Convert a DeST model to EnergyPlus model — to_eplus
text: [eplusr::Idf] converted EnergyPlus model.
